page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY:The Five Lamps
page.content: The{Five Lamps}which stood at the junction of{Westbury St.}and{Mandale {Rd.}was the best known feature of{ {Thornaby.}It was erected in 1874 by private subscription.It was an ornate lamp standard with five lamps mounted on a paved platform. Until the new town centre was built on the airfield,Mandale Rd. was the main shopping centre of Thornaby. Benches were placed around the platform and they provided a meeting place for the people of the town.During elections candidates addressed meetings at the Five Lamps and public parades assembled there.When the new road system was built ten years ago the Five Lamps}were removed.In 1983 a replica was made by apprentices at{ {Head Wrightson's}and it was sited in{ {Westbury St.}about 100m.from its original position.
